project.name: cppcheclipse
project.description:
cppcheclipse is an Eclipse plugin which integrates cppcheck (http://sourceforge.net/projects/cppcheck/) with the CDT project. You can run/configure cppcheck from the Eclipse UI.
Click on Installation for help how to install this plugin.
News2009/10/18 - First public version 0.9 of cppcheclipse available 2009/10/22 - Bugfix release 0.9.1 available which fixes  issue 1 . This bug caused Eclipse to hang under some circumstances. 2009/10/31 - New release 0.9.2 is available which is compatible with Java 1.5 and Eclipse 3.4 and 3.5. It adds support for check suppressions, an automatic update check for cppcheck and lots of bugfixes which include  issue 2  and  issue 3 . 2009/11/22 - New release 0.9.3 available which fixes  issue 4 ,  issue 5  and  issue 6 . The latter could lead to a nasty error, where the error mark was at the wrong positon. Some bugfixes for suppressions were added. 2010/02/03 - Release 0.9.4 available which fixes  issue 7  and  issue 8 . Additionally it adds support for calling it via a shortcut (Ctrl+Shift+C). This release requires cppcheck in at least version 1.40, as it uses its new --enable-flags. Some other bugfixes regarding marker deletion, problem list handling and incremental builder were also included. 2010/02/04 - Just one day later I have to release 0.9.5 since the previous one (and also 0.9.3 I guess) suffered from a serious bug ( issue 10 ), where some of the command line arguments where not correctly transmitted to cppcheck. Furthermore  issue 09  and  issue 11  were fixed. Screenshot
